article.headline: Sacramento State 90, Montana State 82
article.story: SACRAMENTO, Calif. (AP) -- Kris Groce had 21 points and five assists to help Sacramento State beat Montana State 90-82 on Wednesday night. Angel Alamo and Haron Hargrave had 18 points each for the Hornets (9-17, 4-9 Big Sky Conference), which ended a four-game losing streak. Nick Dissly finished with 23 points and Mecklen Davis scored 18 for the Bobcats (10-16, 7-6 Big Sky). Behind 52-44, Dissly scored six of the Bobcats' eight points to trim the Hornets' lead 56-52 with 13:58 left in the second half. The Hornets refused to relinquish the lead and maintained a full-court pressure scheme to build a 14-point spread after a dunk by Roderick Adams at the 3:55 mark. Montana State's Branden Johnson's 3-pointer made the score 82-79 with 57 seconds left, but the Hornets scored their last eight points from the free-throw line. Alamo gave the Hornets their biggest lead at 25-14 in the first half before Montana State came back to trail 35-34 on a two-hand dunk by Ted Morris. Hargrave's 3-point basket at the buzzer left Sacramento State in front with a 38-34 halftime margin. Both teams failed to record any fast-break points in the first half.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
